required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Carotid Atherosclerosis and Vascular Events in People With Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Progression of Carotid Atherosclerosis and Vascular Events in People With Diabetes: A Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: Diabetes is a risk factor for carotid atherosclerotic whose progression is associated with an increased risk of vascular events. Investigators assessed prospectively by arterial duplex ultrasonography the progression of carotid atherosclerosis in a cohort of people with diabetes to assess the importance of progression and to analyze the impact of this progression on vascular events. The main hypothesis is that people with carotid atherosclerosis progression are at higher risk of vascular events than those without any progression.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of vascular events between day one and the last day of follow-up reviewed by patient examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day of the last assessment of carotid atherosclerosis by duplex ultrasonography (between 01/2014 and 09/2016)
primary_outcome.description: Vascular events include ischemic myocardial events, ischemic cerebrovascular events, lower limb ischemia, arterial revascularization procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of carotid atherosclerosis progression measured by duplex ultrasonography in percentage of stenosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day of the last assessment of carotid atherosclerosis by duplex ultrasonography between 01/2014 and 09/2016.
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit, carotid arteries were examined by duplex ultrasonography. The most severe lesion for each patient was selected. Results were classified in three Strandness categories: normal (no atherosclerotic lesions), stenosis < 50% (systolic ratio Internal Carotid Artery (ICA)/Common Carotid Artery (CCA) < 2) and stenosis ≥ 50% (systolic ratio ICA/CCA ≥ 2). A progression was the move to a higher category.

arm_group.description: Patients with diabetes and a carotid assessment by duplex ultrasonography in 2012 in a monocentric diabetic unit

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diabetes and a carotid assessment by duplex ultrasonography in 2012 in a monocentric diabetic unit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >18 ans
- Diabetes
- Carotid duplex ultrasonography in 2012
Exclusion Criteria:

facility.name: Service d'Endocrinologie, Diabète et Maladie de la Nutrition, GH Sud, Hospices Civils de Lyon
